Contact
We welcome questions or comments. Please fill out the form below to contact us.
ISLAND H2O WATER PARK
Phone:
(407) 910-1401
Address:
3230 Inspiration Dr, Kissimmee, FL 34747
Get Directions
DROP US A LINE
We’d love to hear from you! We welcome questions or comments. Please fill out the form below to contact us.
Entering your phone number allows you to receive text messages from Island H2O Water Park. We’ll text you about deals, offers, giveaways, events and more.
Message & data rates may apply. Expect recurring text messages from an automated dialer. See our
Privacy Policy
and
Terms & Conditions
for more information.

Group Event Inquiry
NOT YOUR AVERAGE COMPANY EVENT
At Island H2O Water Park, we provide a company event package that will keep your team talking! We provide a thrilling experience for your team with something fun for everyone. Plus, when you book a company event at Island H2O Water Park, you’ll get bonus benefits like discounted admission, catered meal, private reserved area, and custom logo messaging displayed around the park
Company Outing Event Inquiry

" indicates required fields

CAPTCHA
Δ
Corporate Discount Club at Island H2O Water Park
Offer your employees good any day admission tickets at a substantial discount. Only 44.99!
Email
[email protected]
to get sign up!
Sign up for our
Corporate Discount Club
and you and your employees and members can access our heavily discounted
good any day
tickets and season passes anytime!
There are no upfront costs. Email
[email protected]
to get your program set up and promotional materials! Parking fees are not included.
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
What Should I Bring To Island H2O Water Park?
To make the most of your visit to Island H2O Water Park, we recommend bringing the following essentials:
Swimsuit:
Wear a comfortable swimsuit that’s suitable for water rides and attractions. Swimwear with metal buckles or zippers is not allowed on certain attractions for safety reasons.
Towel:
Bring a towel for drying off between rides or at the end of the day. You can also purchase towels at the park if needed.
Sunscreen:
Protect your skin from the sun by applying waterproof sunscreen before arriving and reapplying throughout the day. Hats and sunglasses are also helpful for sun protection.
Water Shoes or Flip-Flops:
The ground can get hot, so water shoes or flip-flops are recommended. Some attractions may require you to remove footwear, so bring something that’s easy to take on and off.
Extra Clothes:
Having a change of clothes for the trip home can make your ride back more comfortable.
Lock for Locker Rentals (Optional):
Lockers are available for rent to store your belongings safely, and you may bring your own lock if preferred.
Can I Bring Any Company Decorations?
When you book a company event with Island H2O Water Park, you are permitted to bring the following items:
Company Cakes:
Should you want to treat your team to a specialty themed company cake, Island H2O Water Park will allow you to bring it in the park and will even store it for you in Megabytes.
Banners:
Share your company pride with a decorative company banner in your group’s area!
Please
do not bring
the following items:
Balloons:
For the safety of all guests at Island H2O Water Park, we do not allow balloons into the park.
Confetti:
For safety reasons, Island H2O Water Park does not allow confetti in the park.
If you have further questions about what you are and are not permitted to bring to Island H2O Water Park during your company event, please email
[email protected]
When is Island H2O Water Park open?
Island H2O Water Park is a seasonal park operating from March-October. Please check the
operating calendar
before purchasing a season pass or tickets.
Can we leave and re-enter the park on the same day?
Yes! Please be sure to go to guest services before you leave to get a stamp to come back in for the day.
Can I bring my own tubes or rafts?
Guests may not bring any recreational flotation devices into the park. Island H2O Water Park provides life jackets and inner tubes free of charge on a first-come, first-serve basis. Guests may bring their own U.S. Coast Guard approved life jackets.
What are the height requirements/restrictions for each attraction and area?
Please click on “
Attractions
” in the menu to view all height and weight requirements for all areas and attractions at Island H2O Water Park.
Do you offer locker rentals?
Yes! We encourage using a locker to store all valuables and personal items. Various sized lockers are available near the restrooms. Lockers can be rented at the lockers station with credit or debit cards.
Small: $14
Medium: $22
Large: $27
Are tubes available in the park?
Yes! Courtesy tubes are provided for all slides that require a tube, as well as in
Live Lagoon
and
Chat Creek
.
Are changing rooms & showers available?
RYes! Island H2O Water Park offers restrooms/changing rooms throughout the park. Outdoor stand up showers are located throughout the park for rinsing purposes only.
What do you need to know about a water park?
When planning a visit to a water park like Island H2O, here are some key things you should know to ensure a fun and safe experience:
1. Attractions and Rides:
Familiarize yourself with the variety of attractions available, such as water slides, wave pools, lazy rivers, splash zones, and water coasters.
Check if there are any height, weight, or age restrictions for certain rides to ensure everyone in your group can participate.
2. Park Rules and Safety Guidelines:
Review the park’s safety rules, such as requirements for using life jackets, slide positions, or restrictions on bringing outside food and drinks.
Follow all posted safety instructions and listen to lifeguards and staff for a safe experience.
3. Admission Options and Pricing:
Look into different ticket options, such as single-day tickets, season passes, or group rates, which can offer savings.
Check for any promotions, discounts, or special events that may affect pricing or add value to your visit.
4. What to Bring:
Essentials include swimsuits, towels, sunscreen, water shoes, and extra clothing.
Some parks, including Island H2O, may have restrictions on bringing outside food, drinks, or glass containers.
You may want to bring a waterproof phone case, cashless payment methods, or a lock for lockers.
5. Park Amenities:
Many water parks offer amenities such as locker rentals, cabana rentals, and food stands. Check in advance what’s available and consider reserving amenities like cabanas ahead of time.
Look into parking options and fees, and if there are complimentary or discounted parking promotions.
6. Safety Services:
Lifeguards are stationed throughout the park, but it’s always good to know where first aid stations are located in case of an emergency.
Know if the park provides complimentary life jackets or other safety equipment for young or inexperienced swimmers.
7. Weather Policies:
Water parks may close attractions during severe weather, like thunderstorms. Familiarize yourself with the park’s weather-related policies, including refunds or rain checks.
Knowing these essentials can help you make the most out of your day at the water park and ensure a safe and enjoyable experience for everyone in your group.
